Environment Variables

Safe wrappers for Windows environment variable operations with convenient helpers.

use ergonomic_windows::env::*;

Core Functions

get(name: &str) -> Option<String>

Gets an environment variable. Returns None if not set.

set(name: &str, value: &str) -> Result<()>

Sets an environment variable.

remove(name: &str) -> Result<()>

Removes an environment variable.

exists(name: &str) -> bool

Checks if an environment variable exists.

expand(s: &str) -> Result<String>

Expands environment variable references (e.g., %PATH%).

vars() -> HashMap<String, String>

Gets all environment variables as a HashMap.

Example

use ergonomic_windows::env;

// Get and set variables
env::set("MY_VAR", "hello")?;
let value = env::get("MY_VAR");

// Expand references
let system32 = env::expand("%SystemRoot%\\System32")?;
// Result: "C:\\Windows\\System32"

Directory Helpers

Convenient functions to get common Windows directories:

home_dir() -> Option<PathBuf>

User's home directory (%USERPROFILE%).

temp_dir() -> Option<PathBuf>

Temporary directory (%TEMP% or %TMP%).

system_root() -> Option<PathBuf>

Windows directory (e.g., C:\Windows).

program_files() -> Option<PathBuf>

Program Files directory.

program_files_x86() -> Option<PathBuf>

Program Files (x86) directory.

app_data() -> Option<PathBuf>

User's roaming AppData directory.

local_app_data() -> Option<PathBuf>

User's local AppData directory.

program_data() -> Option<PathBuf>

ProgramData directory.

System Info Helpers

username() -> Option<String>

Current user's username.

computer_name() -> Option<String>

Computer name.

processor_count() -> Option<u32>

Number of processors.

processor_architecture() -> Option<String>

Processor architecture (e.g., "AMD64").

path() -> Vec<PathBuf>

PATH environment variable as a list of paths.
